notes.title: Funding
notes.p: This study was primarily funded by the Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council (UK) and the Animal Health and Welfare Network from the European Commission through the project, Improved Understanding of the Epidemiology of Peste-des-Petits Ruminants, led by The Pirbright Institute (BB/L013657/1) and the Royal Veterinary College (BB/L013592/1). The Government of Andorra funded the veterinary activities in which livestock samples from western Uganda were collected. The publication of the paper was supported by the PPR translational award GRTA (EP/T015381/1) to ensure open source for all colleagues.
